Hello Mylar Team,

If Mylar is used together with Subversive, change sets work differently depending on plugin installation order. In particular:
- When all Mylar and Subversive features are installed simultaneously, change sets are working correctly
- If JIRA and Bugzilla Mylar features are not installed or Subversive with Mylar integration is installed before Mylar, change sets don't displayed in the Synchronize view

See details: http://forums.polarion.org/viewtopic.php?t=580

Do you have a clue what can be the reason?

Best regards,
Igor Vinnykov
Subversive Team

Which change sets mode are you using?  See http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Mylar_FAQ#Active_Change_Set_management for an explanation and trouble shooting. 

Also, when this happens, and you deactivate and then activate the task, does the change set reappear?  I would be happy to investigate further, just point me at the source location I should check out.

Hello Mik,

(In reply to comment #1)
> Which change sets mode are you using?  See
> http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Mylar_FAQ#Active_Change_Set_management for an
> explanation and trouble shooting. 

We use "standard" change sets and our implementation provides an ability to see incoming and outgoing change sets simultaneously in the "Both" mode of Synchronize View or separately for "Incoming" and "Outgoing" modes.

> Also, when this happens, and you deactivate and then activate the task, does
> the change set reappear?  

In case of any manipulation with task change set doesn't appear. The same situation, which we see was reported by other people.

> I would be happy to investigate further, just point
> me at the source location I should check out.

You can get the Subversive source code (with the Mylar integration) here: http://svn.polarion.org/repos/community/Subversive

Best regards,
Igor Vinnykov
Subversive Team
Sorry for the slowness Igor, will investigate this tomorrow.

Igor, I just set up my workspace for Subversive, tried to reproduce this with various configurations, but could not get the change sets to fail showing up.  We streamlined all of the startup for 0.8 because we experienced similar race conditions, so from what I can currently discern this is a 0.7 only problem?  Could you please try to reproduce with the latest?  We will be making a dev build available in about two hours so it is best if you use that (download.eclipse.org/technology/mylar/update-site/dev), but you could also try this with 0.8.  Note that I tested on an Eclipse 3.3M3 integration build, but that should not matter.  Please reopen this bug report if you can still reproduce.

Other comments:

* I will keep the org.eclispe.polarion.team.svn.mylar project checked out into my workspace so that I can notify you of API changes.

* It's great that you guys made the Quickstart page for Mylar, I linked it from our FAQ.

* On the update site, all features in the "Subversive Clients" category mistakenly "The feature allows to integrate Subversive team provider with Mylar project" as their description.  For the Mylar feature I suggest something that makes it clear what it adds, e.g. "Provides integration with Mylar's change set management".  For the others I think it would help to be very clear on what they provide because it's unclear to a novice which should be installed.

* I suggest calling the update site category "Subversive Integration" instead of using the plural.

Hello Mik,

Thank you for investigations. Originally we didn't specify dependency of Subversive Mylar integration from the Mylar, so if someone installed Subversive Mylar integration before the Mylar itself then change sets are not work correctly. This problem was resolved since Subversive 1.1.0 M8 build by specifying dependency of Subversive Mylar integration from the Mylar. As a result integration should work. But there are some strange problems with Eclipse update manager, which caused integration problems. We faced them for Subversive update site, so I can suppose that the same situation can have influence on the Subversive Mylar integration.

Namely, when all Subversive features are installed simultaneously, then all works fine, but if some features are installed after other, then following exceptions are happened (for example):

Igor

We experience either the same, or a very similar problem with users installing Mylar.  This is why on the download page we request that users always use the "Search for new features to install" option.  I believe that this is largely due to bug 102457, which unfortunately has seen almost no attention.  If installing all features at once always resolves the problem, we should consider whether this is a duplicate of that bug.  And yes, recommending that both projects always be installed/updates simultaneously is a good thing to do.  Are you declaring an exact or a compatible dependency on the org.eclipse.mylar.team version?  If it's a strict dependency and the user updates Mylar, but does not update the Subversive integration plug-in, the Subversive integration plug-in won't start.
Is it just me, or hyperlink to bug 102457 in Mik's last comment does not work?
Works for me, but I actually meant to link bug 132450.
